While Trump was in office there was no question that he could take classified documents home with him.  No one claimed that national security was at risk and this has been true for all Presidents.  After he left office, whatever classified documents he still had became the property of the National Archives but there are no procedures or deadlines for the transfer.  This is a problem but not a crime and the security risk from the location of the documents is no different than when he was serving. Shill. Special Masters in my experience (23 years as a prosecutor) are for when a search warrant targets a lawyers office. I have never seen them used with search warrants in any other circumstance. And in those cases it is often the prosecutor who requests it to avoid any "appearance" of impropriety. But this is NOT a lawyers office. Furthermore since all the documents have already been reviewed appointing a master is moot, and that should have been the only thing this Trumpian judge should have said after saying in reference to Trump's two week delay "those who sit on their rights, lose them". Instead she gave Trump the delay - the only thing he really wanted in this BIZARRE filing that lacks any request for an interlocutory order (like an injunction). .

“What people are missing, all the other documents taken, even if they
 claim to be executive privilege, either belong to the government 
because they are government records, even if they are classified, even 
if they are subject to executive privilege, they still belong to the 
government and go to the [National Archives],” Barr said.
“And any
 other documents that were seized, like news clippings and other things 
in the boxes containing the classified information, those were seizable 
under the warrant because they show the conditions under which the 
classified information was being held,” he added. “So I think it’s a red
